Class SharedData

java.lang.Object
SharedData
public class SharedData
extends java.lang.Object
A class that stores the data for the game of life in one shared class.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private boolean[][] data
    The game board
    private int readCount
    The read counter
    private static int size
    The size of the game board in cells
    private int writeCount
    The write counter

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SharedData()
    Constructor that initializes read and write count to 0 and creates a new game board preloaded with Gosper's Glider Gun.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getGameSize()
    Returns the size of the game board
    boolean[][] readData​(int offsetX, int offsetY)
    Reads the data and returns a portion of the game board depending on which thread is reading
    void writeData​(int offsetX, int offsetY, boolean[][] d)
    Writes the data from a thread to the game board

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • SharedData

      public SharedData()
      Constructor that initializes read and write count to 0 and creates a new game board preloaded with Gosper's Glider Gun.

  • Method Details

    • readData

      public boolean[][] readData​(int offsetX, int offsetY)
      Reads the data and returns a portion of the game board depending on which thread is reading
      Parameters:
      offsetX - the thread's X offset on the game board
      offsetY - the threads Y offset on the game board
      Returns:
      the portion of the game board specific to the thread calling it

    • writeData

      public void writeData​(int offsetX, int offsetY, boolean[][] d)
      Writes the data from a thread to the game board
      Parameters:
      offsetX - the thread's X offset on the game board
      offsetY - the thread's Y offset on the game board
      d - the data to write

    • getGameSize

      public int getGameSize()
      Returns the size of the game board
      Returns:
